intro: Trichinium densum, commonly known as the dense trichium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescence and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Trichinium densum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
